clinical_study.brief_title: The Guiding Significance of Pupil Monitoring in the Perioperative Period
clinical_study.official_title: The Guiding Significance of Pupil Monitoring in the Perioperative Period

brief_summary.textblock:
The pupil diameter is affected by both sympathetic and parasympathetic nerves, and its latency and response amplitude mainly reflect the functional status of the parasympathetic nerve. Clinically, the diagnosis of neurological diseases can often be made based on changes in pupils.
An appropriate depth of anesthesia can cause minimal damage to the body after surgery, thereby reducing the impact on brain function and cognitive function.
The occurrence of postoperative delirium will have adverse effects on the prognosis of patients, such as prolonging the hospital stay, increasing the mortality of patients after surgery, and increasing early postoperative cognitive dysfunction.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in the level of Mini-Men-tal State Examination scale score
primary_outcome.time_frame: The day before surgery and 1,2,3,7 days after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Assess the cognitive function of the patient by asking questions on the patient scale.A score of 27 to 30 indicates normal cognitive function, and a score below 27 indicates cognitive dysfunction.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in the level of Pittsburgh sleep quality index
primary_outcome.time_frame: The day before surgery and 1,2,3,7 days
primary_outcome.description: Assess the patient's sleep quality by asking questions on the scale.The lower the score, the more serious the sleep disorder.
